website_summaries.verdict: Having the carrier in the front instead of the back helps your bike's stability, and lets your child see more, too.
pros: For children ages 1 to 4, weighing up to 40 pounds
Installs in front of bike saddle to put child in a comfortable, safe position
Deluxe safety harness and oversized buckle system
Even weight distribution for navigating corners
Better visibility and stability than back-mounted
cons: This seat will not work with bikes with brake cables running up the head post
Seat interferes with some cyclists' pedaling

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for bike enthusiasts with a baby
customer_reviews.text: Many people in the street have asked me about this. Very nice for bike enthusiasts with a baby. My daughter started riding here at 9 months old, but this is not designed for that age, so she kept falling asleep and falling sideways. I resolved that with a strap to keep her straight, but it really started getting confy for her around the year. She is almost two and still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Avila

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband to use with his almost- 2-yr-old, and they both love it. My husband likes that his son is close enough they can hear each other talk easily, and his son likes having his hands on the front headrest. They had a blast riding through the woods, the little guy was giggling and yelling “bumps!! More bumps!!” the whole time. Seemed like he felt very secure in this seat. My husband is tall and didn’t have any real trouble with pedaling after the seat was installed. It took about 30 minutes to assemble, and came with very clear instructions. We’re all pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: What a great product. I will say my husband has to ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. I will say my husband has to have this on his bike because my arms are too short to have around the baby and still reach the handle bars on my bike. Other than that, what better could you come up with to keep your little one safe and in your complete control. Our son loves to ride and as you can see he even got a little nap in on our long ride.
customer_reviews.author: volk9726

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike seat
customer_reviews.text: This is the best kids bike seat I have found. The kids love it because they get to be close to mom and feel like they are steering the bike. Mom loves it because the kids feel safe and secure and in case of crash they are basically surrounded by parent to take the impact. On a cruiser bike we find that our legs are forced into sort of an odd position while pedaling, but it isn't difficult to get used to. Maybe the best part is that the positioning of the seat doesn't throw off the balance of the bike so it feels just like riding a regular bike. This makes everything feel so much easier and safer.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Ojeda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install- Kids Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We got this a few months ago, my wife and I go bike riding with our three kids (5, and 2- 2 1/2 year olds). Here is our thoughts on this product: Pro: - Easy to Install - Secure Feel - Easy buckling and the 'rest' area in the front is great (especially if they fall asleep) - Foot Rests for the kids keep their feet out of the way (there's a guard that keeps their legs away from the chain/bike parts as well) Cons: - None found yet, got this a few months ago and have used it multiple times, if anything comes up I'll update this review
customer_reviews.author: Cgot

customer_reviews.title: Great but didn't work on my specific bicycle.
customer_reviews.text: This product would have been absolutely perfect had it fit properly on my bike. I have a beach cruiser and it fit but it was extremely difficult to pedal - tearing up my thighs and knees with every cycle. If it had an adjustable positioning system, it would have worked great! I was very close to just having my husband drill a new hole in the rod to move the seat closer to the handlebars. Amazon was more than happy to let me return the product and issued a refund. I wish this would have fit my bike.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, poor design
customer_reviews.text: The concept of my child riding in front of me intrigued me due to the fact it seemed more engaging for my child and they would catch more air on hot days. In practice however, these are very uncomfortable to use and limit the turning of the handlebars. The only issue I had with the quality was the knob that secures the seat in the proper position on the sliding support bar. The knob did not grip enough to keep the seat from moving closer and closer to my seat while in use. I would recommend reconsidering your other options prior to purchase. But if you are okay with pedaling bow legged, then this is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Summers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and sturdy !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I live in SF and when I have to go up hill with my child on the back, it is not safe. Up front is better. You really have to be careful to make sure you have enough space under your hand bar to fix the main safety bar or you won’t be able to install it.
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: It's very comfortable. I am 5"2 and i don't hit my ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES to go on bike rides, it fits securely and keeps her close. It's very comfortable. I am 5"2 and i don't hit my knees on it at all while riding, but she's low enough to not be to high in my way to see/turn. My husband had a little bit of a hard time installing it but once we figured out it had to be on the seat bar (that goes up and down) it was better. That's the only place the hardwere fit around the bar. That was probably more builder error than product error though. All in all, GREAT PRODUCT. I love having her in front an being able to see her at all times
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, lousy implementation
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loved the concept of riding up and in front, and so did I. The central support bar is a great idea. But come on. You make a child safety item out of disposable utensil plastic?! Goodness gracious. ‘Flimsy’ is the only word i can find. Can probably do its job for a 15 to 20-lb infant, not more. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L

customer_reviews.title: This is the best we found so far
customer_reviews.text: We got this seat after failed another brand. We compared many chairs. This is the best we found so far. It's comfortable that baby can sit and relaxing. I still wish the seatbelt can have improvement because they don't stay on the shoulders. I went to Joanns and bought a strip and connected the seatbelts on his chest so that they can stay on his shoulders. Otherwise, without the seat belts secured, this chair is dangerous. But now the chair is fine. We are happy to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Xintong

customer_reviews.title: Second time around with our second child and it's still my number one !
customer_reviews.text: Love it and for the price and quality you can't go wrong. I love it with my first many and I love it with my second. I like having the baby up front rather than the back. I find it to be safer and allows me to bond more with having the kids up front while riding.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Zabriskie

customer_reviews.title: It definitely looks like toddlers can ride on it and since it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Once this chair is install is just right. We have had it for a couple of weeks now, though the installation process is not the easiest, once it is all set up on the bike it is just right. So be patient following the instructions and it will be just right! Depending on what type of bike it may work a little different. Our little toddler loves riding on it. It definitely looks like toddlers can ride on it and since it is adjustable it grows with the kids up to certain height. Not complaining on this side. We will see how it works
customer_reviews.author: Bob B

customer_reviews.title: my daughter loves to ride with me using this seat.
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loves to ride with me using this seat. Seat is a little too small, but I believe it being small is a plus since it doesn't really block me when we are riding. My daughter is still comfortable when she seats even if the seat looks small. Also the build quality is exceptional. The seat is sturdy and will stay in place when installed correctly. I believe front mounted seats are a lot better than the rear mounted ones.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Isidoro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect until age 3
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter. I felt she is really safe between my arms. She was also more calm. I could speak to her and talk a lot, even singing together while I could focus on traffic as well. Sometime she felt a sleep and could put down her head. I had no issue biking several miles, however you have to keep your leg in a bit different position. Easy to put up and remove. Now she is 4 and to big to sit in.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltan S

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and my daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old (30lb) daughter is a peanut so she fits perfectly. She absolutely loves riding bikes with her dad with this and rests her head on the cushion and relaxes like it’s a pillow. It’s very lightweight but sturdy. I was apprehensive about it until I saw how much she loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Troy Erdlen

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever! My 16 month old absolutely loves this. My husband installed it very easily on my woman's beach cruiser bike and ensured it was tightened appropriately. I saw other reviews that it's not well made but I disagree and think it's perfect. You must follow and read all instructions and safety protocols, that is key to a safe installation. The straps could be a littler wider but overall it's great. My knees barely touch it when I peddle (which is fine) and it's super comfortable for me and her. I've told lots of friends about this bc it's so much fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful seat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful seat!!! I used it all summer for my 21-25 month old. He's about 70% for size and the seat just fit....definitely not much more room. But it was awesome for this past summer! He loved going "very very fast" and being able to see everything. I loved having him close and being able to see and talk with him along the way. He fell asleep once and seemed quite comfy. I'd recommend this seat in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: dimitroff03

customer_reviews.title: Your child will have a great view and the little pad is great if they ...
customer_reviews.text: The model you'll probably receive will not have foot straps or the additional safety strap hat goes under the seat. The instruction manual says those should be included but they are not. I ordered a replacement, but it arrrived missing those items as well. They are additional things that are not really necessary for safe operation. Your child will have a great view and the little pad is great if they fall asleep during the ride, but make sure your shoulder straps are adjusted properly. It does require you to pedal with your Kees apart further than usual, but after a few minutes, you don't notice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product - but can be problematic on mountain bikes / bikes with oversize tubes...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product... I was looking for an alternative to the handlebar carrier or the one that mounts over the rear wheel... and this fits the bill, almost perfectly. Keep in mind that if you mount this on a mountain bike, the oversize tube and the overall geometry *may* be an issue, in that you may not have enough clearance between the cross bar and the handlebar tube to allow the carrier to attach properly. Mine barely fit (got a low end Giant MTB). Other than that, it's good: stable, secure, adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: SittingBull

customer_reviews.title: Not enough space for my knees
customer_reviews.text: The seat looks sturdy an comfortable but I kept bumping my knees on it -even as far in front as I could. Maybe it is because of my bike, I don't know. I decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Laure

customer_reviews.title: This seat is awesome, my wife and I have been stopped about ...
customer_reviews.text: This seat is awesome, my wife and I have been stopped about 100 times out here in AZ while toting our 19 mos old daughter around. People here dont know of it, I recommended it to 3 parents already. My daughter loves it and it makes bike riding fun with her and ther is absolutely no leg interference with biker vs this seat like other units. The only thing to improve is the shoulder straps, like car seats, there should be a chest buckle or something to keep the straps from falling off her shoulders from time to time. Other than that, it is totally the best child bike seat out there and your kid will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves it and we enjoy the rides a lot together. The bar helps to lift the seat a bit to give more leg room for the adult, probably the design could be better in that sense but for sure the seat itself is more comfortable and safe for the kid as alternatives (for front use). We have the blue one and the fabric is also good for using with hot weather.
customer_reviews.author: Mrt

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: My little boy and I love this thing. We first had a bike trailer but it made riding more difficult especially when we rode through areas with crappy or small sidewalks. Plus the space the trailer took up was crazy. This sits right in front of you! My son can see everything and he loves it. You DO have to peddle with your knees slightly apart, which is really weird at first, but I quickly got used to it. We can get around faster and maneuver better than ever and riding with a toddler is so much fun now! It installs fairly easy too!
customer_reviews.author: Soraya

customer_reviews.title: Baby bike seat
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. We used it starting from 11 months old. She loves it and I love that it keeps her in view. Makes you have to ride with your legs slightly askew, but not too awful. I wish it had a chest clip but that’s my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: DEM

customer_reviews.title: Love that its mounted in the front
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research on finding a cost effective child seat I found this which mounts in front of the bicyclist. My son enjoys riding with me far more than he would just starring at my backside like most child seats. installation was incredibly easy and feels very sturdy. I wish it was maybe a tad bigger. My son is three and seems to be just fitting perfectly. I was hoping to get more years out of it. Overall balance is good, unless you child is having a fun time and leaning side to side to see whats beneath them. The seat also is accommodated for when your child falls asleep and can rest their head on the provided armrest.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony I.

customer_reviews.title: Has gone through three children and still like new
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Solid, intuitive, and well-designed. Sitting in front of the parent is great - my kids love to lean back against us as they ride. The hand rest is perfect. From 18 months to 3 years, this is a perfect seat. Our third child is in it now, and it has held up like new.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: I’m short. This doesn’t work well with me because I have to lean in a weird way to reach over the seat and reach my handle bars. It would work better with my husband BUT the way it fits in the bike it won’t work on his. It was only used once to stroll around the block, and now it’s sitting in our garage sell pile. I think I’ll try to find one that sits behind me.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: GREAT bike seat for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: A bit difficult to install, but worth it. Our LO is 16 months old she enjoyed every moment of it! Great seat, very secure, and cool cause they get to see everything in front of them!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa T.

customer_reviews.title: Seems okay.
customer_reviews.text: My concerns are that I had to remove my Kent KZR mountain bikes back light and water bottle to get it fixed. Though I had other lights to work this out. But I would have been with out a back light if I had gone stock. Also, there is just over screw which holds the seat to the bars. The manual says there are safety straps but I didn't receive any. Over all it's just okay.
customer_reviews.author: Spender

customer_reviews.title: She fits great and never had any issue securing it to the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. first one I sold because I thought I wouldn't need it anymore and then had a little surprise. I take my 18 month old daughter on bike rides all the time in this. She fits great and never had any issue securing it to the bike. It's not as comfortable as not have an extra baby on your bike but worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Takes a few rides to get used ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Takes a few rides to get used to, as seat leans into stomach a little bit and pedaling can be slightly bow-legged. The mounting bar part is a little difficult to install, but once it's on, it's definitely strong. Mounting the seat to the bar is very quick and easy however. 2 year old daughter loves going on long rides with mommy!
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Reinecke

customer_reviews.title: My daughter and I love this bike seat
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I love this bike seat. It was super easy to install onto my bike and my 3 year old daughter loves being on the front of the bicycle versus the back. We are able to talk to each other more easily and she's able to have a better view. You will have to get used to riding with your legs adjusting a bit around the seat but it's really not difficult or uncomfortable at all.
customer_reviews.author: mommyO4

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it. The straps don’t hold do tend to fall off her shoulders, but I’m not worried about her falling out since she’s so close in. You definitely have to ride wide legged but it’s worth it. She actually fell asleep in it once. Weight distribution is pretty good too since it’s on the bar. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies and toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I really like this seat. We live in a small beach town and ride our beach cruisers every weekend. I always get looks when I'm riding with my son, everyone is just in love with this seat and my son LOVES that he can look around and see where we are going. My only complaint is that is IS kind of small, but I think that by the time our son outgrows it he can ride his own bike (with training wheels). He is 9 months old, 28 inches and 21lbs and fits perfectly in the seat.
customer_reviews.author: SBKaren

customer_reviews.title: This seat looks small like its made for a baby doll but its supposed ...
customer_reviews.text: This seat looks small like its made for a baby doll but its supposed to be little so ur kid can sit in front of you and u can still ride the bike. the seat comes to the mid back and straps come up over babys shoulders. I love this little seat and so does my son! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great! It was a little tricky to ensemble
customer_reviews.text: It works great! It was a little tricky to ensemble. We followed the directions but then realized one of the steps was incorrectly misplaced and had to do it all over again, however, once everything was in place worked perfectly. We tried it at home first and then went for a ride to a trail nearby. Our baby loved it! He almost fell asleep on it. It is the perfect fit for our 9 mo who is 22lbs and 30in long. My husband had no problem riding the bike. He was concerned about having to ride with the seat in between his knees but it wasn't a problem at all. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mexgirl

customer_reviews.title: We love this. It is great for my daughter because ...
customer_reviews.text: We love this. It is great for my daughter because she is able to see everything. I also think it is better for center of gravity and safer as my arms are around her at all times. People love it as we pass as it is a newer style and they have not seen it before. The front pad is great since she has fallen asleep on it several times during longer bike rides.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S.

customer_reviews.title: Really like this
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I really like this seat. It doesn't get in my way much, and now my baby can enjoy the view from the front. Best of all, when she gets restless, I don't feel like my center of gravity is thrown in the least. Might get another for future babies that the wife can throw on her bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob F.

customer_reviews.title: I really want to love this bike seat
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a few weeks and LOVED having my three-year-old right in front of me on the bike. We can talk easily; she can see everything; the balance is a piece of cake; it's fantastic. Unfortunately, you really have to cycle with your knees way out to avoid hitting the bike seat. Fine for a mile ride to the park, maybe, but not for a long ride or commute. So I switched to using a rear seat, and while I really miss the great aspects of the front seat, I don't miss hitting my knees with every rotation of the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie

customer_reviews.title: I really recommend this child bike
customer_reviews.text: I really recommend this child bike. If you a person who love Bicycle ride and want to be with your child and watching In front of you this is the product, my son is 18 pound 10 months and it fits perfectly we even got this Bear helmet. We love this 😍
customer_reviews.author: Venni13

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my one-year-old and it's awesome! Install was super easy and it's not too bulky to drive comfortably. I do have to make wider turns due to having a Schwinn cruiser with the angled handlebars but it's not a huge sacrifice. I wouldn't be making any hard turns with a child on board anyway. My child really loves being up front and able to see everything while still being close to mama.
customer_reviews.author: SabreGirl

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves to be on a bike ride. She so happy to be siting front and center. Only thing I don't like are the straps. They are not secure enough, had to make my own adjustments so I felt my daughter was safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is great, it looks odd and somewhat inappropriate
customer_reviews.text: this is great, it looks odd and somewhat inappropriate. LOL but it works great. My one year old enjoys our rides. I like that it's padded so her little butt won't hurt when we do long rides. Don't expect to be able to go extremely fast because you need to open your legs a little wider than normal to be able to ride with the seat in front of you.
customer_reviews.author: S. Corea

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to go on bike rides with his daddy. This seat is on my husband's bike, and he has no trouble with it. I, however, cannot ride my husbands bike with this on because there is not enough room for me to comfortably get on and off his bike; this is most likely because of the height of the bike and less to do with the baby seat. (I'm short.) We are going to try it on my bike to see if it will work for me, but even if it doesn't, this is awesome for my husband's bike. I have a friend who is 5'5" and she has no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: CME

customer_reviews.title: Happy mommy and baby
customer_reviews.text: This child seat is perfect for riding. We like having our son ride in front of us so we can see him better. He likes the view from up front too. The headrest option is nice too if he gets tired, and it would serve as crash protection too which was thoughtful.
customer_reviews.author: LLCoolJeff

customer_reviews.title: Stop your search, this is the seat for you!
customer_reviews.text: This seat is AMAZING... we use it ALL the time, it's steady as far as if he moves around, which he doesn't really. He gets to see everything and it's so comfy for him. I would not buy another seat, this is TOTALLY worth it! Also, it's easy to bike with it on, there is not really any change in the way you ride. We have gone all over with this on the bike and it's so fun, everyone always comments how cool it is... and how they all wished they had one of these when they had little ones. It's also reasonably priced. Very cool product!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie R.

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS INSTEAD OF THE BIKE TRAILER YOU'VE BEEN THINKING ABOUT
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh yes, yes, and YES. I was searching high and low for a bike trailer but saw this and ordered it on a whim. I LOVE IT! I love that baby is in front of me so I can keep an eye on her and we can still chat while we're out for a ride. It does make me ride a bit off my usual stance (more knees-out), but I'm not out doing 10 mile rides, just leisurely rides down by the Bay. I never felt unstable using this (until baby decides she wants her hands on the handlebars, but that's not the WeeRide's fault). Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great for short rides around residential areas
customer_reviews.text: I've taken my 17 month old son on a few rides around the residential block so far and he seems to enjoy it. My bike's frame is very unique so I found it surprising how easy the product was to install. My only peeve with this product is the shoulder harness, which is cheap and easily loosens.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin D. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old loves this! I originally bought it for my bike, but there wasn't enough space for me to stand in between the seat and the rider. My husband had to put it on his bike. I was a little disappointed about that, but I don't have a standard bike; it is a comfort bike made by Del Sol. I'm thinking that makes a difference because other reviewers never commented on the space issue. I'm standard size as well; 5'6". I/we still love it and HIGHLY recommend. We also bought the WeeRide co-rider for our 4 year old, we also have a 9 year old; finally our entire family can take long rides together!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: So very difficult to install on bicycle
customer_reviews.text: While the device was very sturdy and worked well while my then 2 year old son would accompany me on bicycle rides it was incredibly difficult to install on the bicycle. The directions were easy enough to follow however when you tighten the screw the other side would move. So hopefully whoever is putting this onto you bicycle they are coordinated enough to tighten both sides simultaneously. All in all it is a great seat if you can put it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my almost 1 year old so that we could take bike rides as a family. It's been great. It was very easy to install and fits well on my bike. The baby took a little while to get used to it but now she loves it. Even the mention of a bike ride and she gets excited. I like having her close where I can talk to her while we ride and she knows I am close and is therefore more comfortable. I do find that I have to flare my legs out a bit while I'm riding and I'm wondering if adjusting the pedals on my bike might help with this very slight discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: S. Benefiel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ride
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bike for my grandson who weighs about 23 pounds and is just under a year. He loves it and is very comfortable riding. I had a joey seat for him mama, but it was more of a banana boat seat which was not as comfy as this little seat. Also, it comes with the "tray" in front, which is good protection when we go on bumpy dirt roads. Also, when he's tired, he does lay his face down. This is too big to have between your knees if you are a short person. We love this seat and the price was reasonable for the construction of the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Nez

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I've been wanting to get exercise in and my stroller wasn't cutting it so I began researching cycling with toddlers. My little one is 18 months and we just used it for the first time and she didn't wanna come inside at all! Installation was super easy and my daughter seems snug as a bug on a rug in it. I definitely recommend this ❤
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

customer_reviews.title: This is a Great Option for our Toddler
customer_reviews.text: We love this. The material is soft and the product itself was easy to install on my bike (Electra Cruiser). The only thing I don’t like is that I can’t quite get the straps tight enough to keep from slipping off his shoulders. It seems perhaps the option to tighten in the back to bring the straps closer to his neck would have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mare

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bike Seat!
customer_reviews.text: This front facing bike seat allows our son to "see the world" as we're cruising around. It's construction is high quality, ergonomically designed and the seat & front pad are cushioned for a comfy ride. The 5-point harness & foot rest are good safety features, too. We've taken it on local rides & during our big camping trip this past Summer. The seat is easy to remove from the mounting bar, which is convenient when loading up our bikes on the rack. The only criticism, albeit very minor, is the mounting bar is not easily removed for switching to another bike. However, this is better for safety.
customer_reviews.author: ScE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For My Adult Trike
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my adult trike. It is perfect for my 10 month old son to ride in. I purchased several seats trying to find one that would work for my trike, this is the only one that attached properly to the front tube of the bike. This was important to me because I did not want something attached to the handle bars that would interfere with steering, but it could not go behind my seat because of the two tires and basket. This seat is PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Blademaster103

customer_reviews.title: Love this seat
customer_reviews.text: Daughter was 10 months, now almost a year and she absolutely loves this seat. I do too. It's so easy to get her in and out of and she can't affect my riding ability. I can talk to her and sing to her when she gets fussy rather than having to turn around to see what's happening. I love having her right in front of me and feel so much more in control of our entire ride and her safety if anything happens. Seat is super comfy too...
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Relyea

customer_reviews.title: people turn their head...
customer_reviews.text: ... when they see our toddler in it. She loves it. The straps are so-so, but your arms on the sides act as extra protection so it works out. We don't have a tall kid and her feet still tend to remain slightly outside where they should be placed. It's easy to take the whole thing off because it's just 1 bolt that holds the whole thing to the support bar. I'm not sure if 1 bolt is a good thing, but on the flip side if you need to toss your bike on to a hitch/carrier, then it's easy to take this thing off quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a little child
customer_reviews.text: We are now able to take our 9 month old on a bike ride and he doesn't have to stare at my rear the entire time. He loves sitting in front of me and having the wind hit him in the face. The only problem is that he is so cute and smiles at everyone riding by that they almost crash! I know it says it's rated up to 40 lbs but my daughter in 1st grade who is small for her age weighs just under 40 lbs would never fit in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: J E

customer_reviews.title: A good seat- good price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and perfect for American "Mountain" Bikes. I was leary of other European bike seats because they didn't look to fit the standard American bike. This is secure, but also easy to slide off if I want to ride my bike without the seat. My child loves it and although my legs do have to ride a little wider to fit the seat/baby- it's not enough to make me super uncomfortable. If I was to ride a LONG distance, I think it would grow old, but I've only done 3-5 mile trips.
customer_reviews.author: E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Safe for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: Best seat for your little one. A few benefits: - installs easily - safe location for child...middle of bike - fits range of size kids...my daughter has been using since she was one and will continue past three years old - safe for driver...middle of bike keeps weight distributed Buy this one. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny T

customer_reviews.title: Great bicycling for you and your young toddler
customer_reviews.text: This was okay to install, but once it was on - it was great. I like that my son was in front of me and he was more comfortable too. This is a great product. He was comfortable with the padding in front of him and the feet holder. He was easy to manage with him right in front of me. I only wish my son didn't out grow it - they do need to grow. He was able to ride it until he was four years old. He is a little four year old - about 32 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: kathykreates

customer_reviews.title: Love this and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this more stars! I wasn't sure about it at first but I LOVE this! I'm 5'3" and use this on my 26" bike for my 20 month old. When we put it together, we were afraid it would be too small for him, but once installed (very simple assembly btw) it fit perfectly. There is plenty of leg room for me and it is so secure for him. It doesn't take much getting used to and feels so safe. My son loves the ride and I highly recommend this for those who love leisurely rides and want to share that experience with your child.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: I love this seat and so does my 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: I love this seat and so does my 1 year old. We take bike rides almost daily now. Seat attaches easily to the bike, took about 20 minutes to assemble, by myself. Looks small when you assemble it, but my child fits in it just fine. She's about 19 months and 30 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mister.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a kid that's old enough to tell you when they had enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who was under one at the time. As soon as he fell asleep he became dead weight, and since there was really no sides to this he would look as if he was falling out, and made the ride a bit unstable for me. I didn't feel comfortable enough to ride with him since he couldnt tell me he was tired or not. I would suggest this be used with a kid big enough to express their emotions but keep in mind its up to fifty pounds. I ended up buying a trailer, so I don't use it and intend on selling it.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Extra small. Only big enough for a small baby. My grandson is 1 and it was too small for him
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars but I thought the foot rest design was weak - should either extend further or be removable. Pros: easy to install/remove (at least the seat part), allows biker to balance weight extremely easy, comfortable for the child, nice to have the kid right in front of you. Cons: foot rest not removable/doesn't extend too far (rated for children up to 40 lbs, but they will outgrow it long before then), rider must adjust the way you pedal to accommodate, not suitable for rides longer than a few miles. Net: great product for the price, exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Juss Taguy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for outdoor
customer_reviews.text: Super nice product. And good quality material. The only thing is if the feet stand was adjustable that would be great
customer_reviews.author: Dayi

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled to get my new bike & be able to get a seat for my 17 month old daughter. These at appears petite at first glance, but works great when installed & she is in it. It's not meant to be a high-back seat like a highchair, but instead goes to about her shoulder blades, & the seat has plenty of room to go for her. I only wish I had gotten it sooner. Our first ride ended with tears b/c she didn't want to get off, lol. I call that success! I have a women's 26" beach cruiser style bike, and this went on very easily & securely.
customer_reviews.author: jc0921

customer_reviews.title: Wish we'd have gotten it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: My 21 month old is not a small child. He's 29 lbs and 34 inches tall. Fits in the seat very nicely and I think we'll be able to use it for a while. He loves going for rides and I love that I can not only see him, but my bike doesn't feel wobbly with him on it. We had that problem with our older daughter and a seat that goes behind you. I've recommended this to all of my friends. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kay Marie

customer_reviews.title: Have to manipulate it to make it work!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it a 4 star because the way it came would not work with a modern bike frame. We had to manipulate it to make it work which made me neevous. Also the seat is only held on by 1 bolt. However, when using it its very cute and fun for my 10 month old son ( we actually used it when he was 9.5 months). He is 23 lbs and it fits him well. It is small like others say about it and won't last us much longer but it allowed us to enjoy our bike ride.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Wendt

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this baby bike seat. Doesn't alter my riding much. Easy to install. Feels safe and secure. My daughter absolutely loved her first ride in it. Much better than the rear baby bike seats.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this seat
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my own use and one as a gift for someone. I LOVE this seat! My son loved being right up front and I felt like I had great stability and control. It didn't affect my pedaling much at all. I highly recommend this over a back seat position!
customer_reviews.author: PAJ2336

customer_reviews.title: Love it But Cant use it!
customer_reviews.text: We just got this from UPS less then 5 mins ago. We were so excited. Opened the package and my husband and I looked at each other and knew it wouldn't fit our son. But just in case we put him in it (in the kitchen with hubby holding the back) there is no way! My son is 1 1/2 but he is tall and skinny. He is just over 23 lbs. He is just too tall. We are going to have to return it. It would fit our neighbors kid just great, she wears size 6-12 month old clothing. LOVE the concept, it just wont work with our kid. Nicely built.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Fun rides!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son when he was 15 months, we first got one that sits on the back but he would have to turn his head to the sides to be able to see out or he would be starring onto his dads back(no fun in that!) so we purchased this one and it been one of the best investments we made! With my son sitting in the front its easier to hand him water and snacks as we ride and interact with him as we ride. After four months of use it is still great and our son loves it!! On installation, it took my husband about 20 min to install.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great in theory but too close for my small frame.
customer_reviews.text: We loved the idea of this since it was easy to install & I could be watching the baby as we ride. He just loved it! But it was unfortunately quite uncomfortable for me since I am only 5'0" I ended up hunching over him (& he's only 16 months) so that I wouldn't bump his head with my chest and arms which was quite an uncomfortable ride when you combine it with having to pedal with my knees sticking out to not kick the seat. I really liked this idea but it just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: VVD

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this!!!! At first I thought it looked small, but once my son was in it it was the perfect size. Don't let it fool you. Very easy to assemble and attach to the bike. My son sees everything when he rides and uses the front panel as his make believe steering wheel. This seat does not feel bulky. Easy to maneuver the bike with it attached. And since he is in the center if he moves it doesn't throw off the weight distribution.
customer_reviews.author: rachel moya

customer_reviews.title: Evacuate the Building
customer_reviews.text: Because this thing is the bomb! Our daughter absolutely loves this - as does my wife! Way safer than the child riding on the back of the bike. We live in an area with tons of children and moms/dads pedaling their children all over the place. Interestingly enough, everywhere we go someone asks us "Where did you get that seat???" Great product, and would highly recommend! Oh yea, it's easy to install...took me 10 minutes, and I pay people to fix most everything at my house.
customer_reviews.author: 90slow50

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but a little small.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for bike rides, and keep my boy where I can see him. However, it seems small and my son seems like he will grow out of it long before hitting the weight limit. I do like the padded part in the front, to stop him in case of a crash, but I've been careful when riding with him and haven't testing this feature yet. He does like to hold onto it though, and it keeps him from trying to "help" me steer.
customer_reviews.author: escortwagon313

customer_reviews.title: It’s all around a great purchase. My daughter loves it and it has ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this seat for probably around a year now. I don’t have many complaints about it. It’s all around a great purchase. My daughter loves it and it has provided for hours of outdoor fun and exercise for our family. The only thing that could be improved on are the straps. They’re very confusing to adjust and I haven’t been able to find very helpful info on adjusting them either.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My one year old went for rides with me all summer in this seat. I have a crusing bike that this atached to with no problem. It won't attach to my husbands road bike, but I knew that before I purchased it. It was easy for me to install with a few basic tools and doesn't get in my way while riding. You do have to ride with your knees slightly out, but not much. I love that I can watch my son while I am riding. He asks to go for bike rides all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mamabear

customer_reviews.title: Great seat!
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat! Bought it for my 1.5 year old and he loves it! Solid construction, and for our bikes (Schwinn GS Comfort Bikes) it was an easy install. The fact that it allows our child to be in front of us and in case of a fall, offers our arms as additional protection was a big selling point. Please note on a smaller framed bike, if your seat is too low and the child seat is too far back, it might get in the way of your pedaling.
customer_reviews.author: Sunup Hwang

customer_reviews.title: but my son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have an active little one so he enjoys sitting up front and pretending he's doing all the work. And if he's tired he just rests his head down My problem is that I'm top heavy so every time there's a big hill I have to walk it otherwise I smother my son into the head rest. My husband only has a road bike so we only mount it on my hybrid.
customer_reviews.author: Katanne

customer_reviews.title: Best child bike seat
customer_reviews.text: The kangaroo seat is our absolute favorite child seat. My son loves riding in it because he can see every thing on our rides and is able to rest his head if needed. It is very durable (we've had it for a year and a half) and sturdy structure. We use it on rides at least twice weekly and it shows very little sign of wear. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: My son loves, but my knees hit
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES riding in this. I really like that he is in front of me on my bike instead of behind and he likes that too. the one thing I don't like is that my knees hit when I pedal so I have to kinda turn my knees out to avoid hitting.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kolbeck

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bike seat. I will be honest it does hurt my knees a bit having to pedal kind of funky, but my little man loves it!! I like being able to see him and I can feed him snacks and pass him his water cup. He can hear me when I talk to him and when he gets tired he just simply rests his head on the pillow in front of him.
customer_reviews.author: kerker

customer_reviews.title: Fun for baby
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 8 month old son. It works really well although he is not quite tall enough to see over the padding that goes in front of him. We are glad it has that though, because if his face goes forward, it will hit something padded. We love that this allows our child to sit in front of us on the bike so he can see also. It is a 4-star rating because you do have to adjust how you pedal, but it is something you can get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Barnard Family

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike seat! Our one year old adores his bike rides - he even hums as dad pedals! It is very comfortable and easy to install. The only slight issue is that the shoulder straps don't always stay put. We had to make them pretty tight, other than that it is fantastic! My husband did a ton of research on these seats and compared other brands, this seat met all our needs! It also had the best weight capacity (our son is on the heavier side) so we will be able to use it for a longer time. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: E Lu

customer_reviews.title: Too Small for our 32 lb granddaughter.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the WeeRide for my great granddaughters 3rd birthday. She weighs 32lbs. The information states that the seat is for a child up to 40 lbs. Not so for my granddaughter. She is tall for her age and although she is in the correct wt. range, she was much too tall for the seat even at it's most extended range. It does look well made and comfortable but it is more for 18mos to 24 month old. But that being said, it is really hard to judge purchasing it online. I didn't really want to rate this item as we never really got to use it but I can't submit this review without a rating.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Pinkston-Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat difficult to assemble but once on it worked great! My little guy loves it and looks so safe and comfy while we cruise about.
customer_reviews.author: CynSanDiaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: We love this bike seat! We have had so many compliments on the seat and have been extremely happy with our choice. I love having my daughter sit in front of me. I like that you can adjust how far back the seat sits and the straps to hold the child in. My 18 month old fits perfect in it and I think she will fit for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Travis D.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! My daughter loves this we got this when she was 15 months old and it's perfect! The only thing I wish is for a way to make the shoulder straps tighter they tend to get loose every once in awhile. But overall LOVE it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Love it and my G.D. loves it too!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this seat and the iBert for my G.B. and chose this seat after trying them both. The seat positioning #1, the comfort and growth possibilities #2 and the product material #3. I highly recommend this seat :)
customer_reviews.author: Harley Diva

customer_reviews.title: Best thing everrrrrrr
customer_reviews.text: Best thing everrrrrrr!!! My son loved riding up front. Everywhere we e go people stop us and ask us where we got it. I love that my son doesn't have to stare at his dads back the whole ride.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L Hunsaker

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it  easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I order the first one years ago for my daughter and the straps Messed up from being in the weather so I ordered one just like it and we love it just as much! Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Allison Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: <3 it
customer_reviews.text: We previously had a WeeRide seat but have two children so they would have to take turns riding with us. Both children ages 1 and 3 enjoyed riding along with us but hated sharing so we purchased a second WeeRide seat and installed it on our other bike and now both of them are able to ride and they love it because they can see everything instead of looking at our backs... also with the seat over the bar it centers the added weight of the child when riding.
customer_reviews.author: Boogies

customer_reviews.title: It's our 2nd! The kids love to ride up front.
customer_reviews.text: At 1st I disliked the ratchet mechanism for the hold down bolt between the kids legs. Upon further consideration I'm glad the kids can't loosen it when you can't see there hands!
customer_reviews.author: Franklin W. Tucker, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars but it's really really small. My 3 year old's legs are a bit cramped but it's worth it because she gets to ride up front. I purchased "the other brand" before, which was more expensive but it did not fit onto my adult tricycle. Everywhere we go people comment on how cool our setup is. Sadly she won't fit it in pretty soon. But all in all great product.
customer_reviews.author: VibrantStar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fit but
customer_reviews.text: -This seat is easy to mount but is quite small. Our normal-sized two-year old could barely slide into the seat and seemed to be in a rather precarious perch. The seat also impedes the riders ability to control the bicycle easily; and results in a very top-heavy bicycle.. I much prefer a seat mounted behind the rider to provide better balance and control. This seat is not a bad product but it didn't suit our needs.
customer_reviews.author: DrBob

product_meta.title: WeeRide LTD Kangaroo Child Bike Seat
feature_bullets: Unique front-position child bike seat with ultra-thick seat and back padding
Installs in front of the bike saddle to put your child in a comfortable, safe position (mounting bar included)
Deluxe safety harness and oversized buckle system for maximum safety
Distributes weight evenly for added stability when navigating corners.For children 1-4 years old,Maximum weight: 33 lbs.
Adjustable foot holders and plush headrest; installs easily on most bikes
